Few subjects demand as open a mind as history, whose permanent &quot;truths&quot; are perhaps more fragile and transient than those of any other discipline, demanding reinterpretation with every layer of knowledge we add, with every ounce of wisdom we accrue. 
That is, perhaps, why we love it so much, and why our 70-lecture SuperCourse, The History of the United States, promises you a learning experience of uncommon richness and intellectual excitement. For rather than offering you still another accumulation of raw factsÃ¢â‚¬â€the dates, battles, elections, treaties or forms of government youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve already spent a lifetime assimilatingÃ¢â‚¬â€this course speaks, instead, to the why of things, the significance of those facts, and the way they fit together to reflect the past and foreshadow the future.

In these lecturesÃ¢â‚¬â€taught by three history professors of exceptional insight and teaching skillÃ¢â‚¬â€youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll experience the past four centuries not simply as a torrent of sequentially linked events, but as an ongoing evolution of intellectual and social forces, within which even the facts youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve known for years bristle with the kind of fresh, provocative meaning that makes your commitment to lifelong learning a joy.
